main event: A bright, flashing object was spotted in the sky over Winston-Salem, North Carolina on February 24, 1958.
interesting points: The object was described as cigar-shaped, silver-gray in color, and flashing like a candle.
The object disappeared suddenly after being observed for about 15 seconds.
Witnesses included a clerk at the Reynolds Tobacco Company in Winston-Salem.
The sighting was recorded in a Project Blue Book report, which is part of the U.S. Air Force's investigation of UFOs.
There were no photographs taken of the object.
sighted object: cigar-shaped, silver-gray object with flashing light
location: 1-1/2 miles south of Winston-Salem, North Carolina
